text: Aarón Padilla Gutiérrez (July 10, 1942 - June 14, 2020) was a Mexican football striker. He played for the Mexico national team between 1965 and 1970. He was part of the Mexico squad for the 1966 and 1970 World Cups. At club level, Padilla played for Pumas, Atlante, and Veracruz. He was born in Mexico City. Padilla Gutiérrez died of COVID-19 in Guadalajara, Mexico on June 14, 2020 at the age of 77.Muere Aarón Padilla, exdirectivo de los Pumas de la UNAM, a causa de Covid-19 ==References== Category:1942 births Category:Sportspeople from Mexico City Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Mexico Category:Mexican footballers
title: Aarón Padilla Gutiérrez
